ext_description.p: An Interconnect_module_cavity_surface is a type of . When this information is represented by a planar shape, the interpretation is to be that the planar shape represents a projection of the maximum extent of the Interconnect_module_cavity_surface onto the planar shape. The Interconnect_module_cavity_surface forms an internal physical boundary of the interconnect substrate. The Interconnect_module_cavity_surface is represented by a closed curve in two dimensional representations and by a manifold surface in three dimensional representations.
ext_description.note: Care should be taken in pre-processors to ensure that both two and three dimensional representations adhere to reasonable industrial practice regarding tangential intersections of curves and straight line segments.

The Interconnect_module_cavity_surface is represented as a simple or complex
in the design view.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
for the Interconnect_module_cavity_surface.
The reference_surface shall not be this Interconnect_module_cavity_surface.

Only a
shall be used as the shape model for an Interconnect_module_cavity_surface.

ext_description.p:
An Interconnect_module_cutout_segment_surface is a type of . An Interconnect_module_cutout_segment_surface identifies a segment of the cutout surface of the
for fabrication and assembly purposes. The curve representing this concept in two dimensional representations shall be open. The surface representing this concept in three dimensional representations shall be non-manifold. Pre-processors shall adhere to the requirement that the boundary this segment is contributing to shall be closed.
ext_description.note: This data is usage view contextual data.
ext_description.p:
If a design view is provided and this member of Interconnect_module_cutout_segment_surface is specified by a member of
in the role of , a member of
shall be the only possibilities permitted to be specified for the role of
for that member of .

specifies the final
for an Interconnect_module_cutout_segment_surface.

specifies the initial
for an Interconnect_module_cutout_segment_surface.

specifies the
for an Interconnect_module_cutout_segment_surface.
The end_vertex shall not be the start_vertex.

ext_description.p:
An Interconnect_module_cutout_surface is a type of a
that is completely through the material of the
in the . When this information is represented by a planar shape, the interpretation is to be that the planar shape represents a projection of the maximum extent of the Interconnect_module_cutout_surface onto the planar shape. The Interconnect_module_cutout_surface forms an internal physical boundary of the interconnect substrate. The Interconnect_module_cutout_surface is represented by a closed curve in two dimensional representations and by a manifold surface in three dimensional representations.
ext_description.note: Care should be taken in pre-processors to ensure that both two and three dimensional representations adhere to reasonable industrial practice regarding tangential intersections of curves and straight line segments.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
Only a
shall be used as the shape model for an Interconnect_module_cutout_surface.

ext_description.p:
An Interconnect_module_edge_segment_surface is a type of . An Interconnect_module_edge_segment_surface identifies a segment of the edge surface of the
for fabrication and assembly purposes. The curve representing this concept in two dimensional representations shall be open. The surface representing this concept in three dimensional representations shall be non-manifold. Pre-processors shall adhere to the requirement that the boundary this segment is contributing to shall be closed.
ext_description.note: This data is usage view contextual data.
ext_description.p:
If a design view is provided and this member of Interconnect_module_edge_segment_surface is specified by a member of
in the role of , a member of
or a member of
shall be the only possibilities permitted to be specified for the role of
for that member of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the final
for the Interconnect_module_edge_segment_surface.

specifies the initial
for the Interconnect_module_edge_segment_surface.

specifies the
for the Interconnect_module_edge_segment_surface.
The end_vertex shall not be the start_vertex.

ext_description.p:
An Interconnect_module_edge_surface is a type of . An Interconnect_module_edge_surface identifies the edge surface of the
for fabrication and assembly purposes. When this information is represented by a planar shape, the interpretation is to be that the planar shape represents a projection of the maximum extent of the Interconnect_module_edge_surface onto the planar shape. The Interconnect_module_edge_surface forms an outer physical boundary of the interconnect substrate. The Interconnect_module_edge_surface is represented by a closed curve in two dimensional representations and by a manifold surface in three dimensional representations.
ext_description.note: Care should be taken in pre-processors to ensure that both two and three dimensional representations adhere to reasonable industrial practice regarding tangential intersections of curves and straight line segments.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
Only a
shall be used as the shape model for an Interconnect_module_edge_surface.
An Interconnect_module_interface_terminal is a type of .
the terminal shall be an .

ext_description.p: An Interconnect_module_primary_surface is a type of . An Interconnect_module_primary_surface identifies the primary surface of the for fabrication and assembly purposes. A member of shall be populated in order to associate this object to the primary if a design view of the substrate is included in the data. An Interconnect_module_primary_surface is an approximation of the real primary surface.
ext_description.note:
It is not usually the case that the physical material visible on the surface of the substrate or pcb is the same material as that of the primary . The level of information provided by this object is usually sufficient for assembly purposes, but will be in error by the thickness of the
above the primary . That will be the material of at least part of the surface of the substrate. Full three-dimensional representation capability and location of individual
associated by
to the component feature being assembled to the substrate is required to represent exactly the mating conditions.

ext_description.p: An Interconnect_module_secondary_surface is a type of . An Interconnect_module_secondary_surface identifies the secondary surface of the for fabrication and assembly purposes. If a design view is populated, and correlation to a is provided, the associated with this member of shall be the last in the design.
ext_description.note: The , and provide supporting data needed to resolve the position of the in the design. Because the secondary surface is derived structurally from the primary , there is no approximation made in the description.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Interconnect_module_surface_feature is a type of . Each Interconnect_module_surface_feature is either an , an , an , an , an , an , or an .
An Interconnect_module_surface_feature identifies a surface of the for fabrication and assembly purposes, particular to support .

ext_description.p: specifies a role of the for the Interconnect_module_surface_feature.

An Interconnect_module_terminal is a type of . The Interconnect_module_terminal identification is provided by the
attribute inherited from . The string may include a substring that indicates to a person the connector the Interconnect_module_terminal is associated with. An Interconnect_module_terminal may be referenced by a member of
to identify a connection requirement for the .
ext_description.note:
The Interconnect_module_terminal may be an
but this fact is not structurally captured in this application object due to the need to require that the Interconnect_module_terminal shall be one of the two specified subtypes.

This part of ISO 10303 does not explicitly model, in a usage view, the relationship of a printed connector to an
in addition to the associated_definition relationship provided in this Application Object.

example.p: Figure 1 illustrates a detail of a usage view that shows an Interconnect_module_terminal that is a part of an edge finger connector.

ext_description.p:
specifies a role of the
for the Interconnect_module_terminal.

specifies a role of the
for the Interconnect_module_terminal. There may be more than one
for an Interconnect_module_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the source system contains the data, then the data shall be provided.
ext_description.note:
The specified by the terminal or mounting feature may be the same
that is specified by the associated . In this case the whole terminal is the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Interconnect_module_terminal_surface_constituent_relationship is a type of .
the text value equal to 'interconnect module terminal surface constituent relationship'.
one of the instances of that is part of the relationship.
the other instance of that is part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.

An Interconnect_module_usage_view is a type of
to support the application of an interconnect in an assembly. Predefined support for typical features found in industrial practice is provided. An Interconnect_module_usage_view may be a . Either the thickness_over_dielectric_requirement or the thickness_over_metal_requirement shall be provided. If both the thickness_over_dielectric_requirement and the thickness_over_metal_requirement are provided, the thickness_over_metal_requirement shall be greater than the thickness_over_dielectric_requirement. An Interconnect_module_usage_view provides physical shape and logical connection identification and location information for an interconnect.

specifies a role of the
for the Interconnect_module_usage_view. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Interconnect_module_usage_view. There shall be one or more
for each located_thickness_requirement. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Interconnect_module_usage_view. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The thickness_over_dielectric_requirement references a base dielectric and not final finish dielectrics.

for the Interconnect_module_usage_view. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Located_interconnect_module_thickness_requirement is a definition that relates a specific location with a thickness requirement for an interconnect substrate.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Located_interconnect_module_thickness_requirement is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Located_interconnect_module_thickness_requirement as its . There shall be one or more for a Located_interconnect_module_thickness_requirement.

specifies the
that is the bound for the Located_interconnect_module_thickness_requirement.

specifies the role of the
for the Located_interconnect_module_thickness_requirement.
The combination of the design and the reference_location shall be unique within a population of Located_interconnect_module_thickness_requirements.

ext_description.p:
A Layered_interconnect_module_usage_view is a type of
that provides the information necessary to include the in its next higher level assembly for design and some simulation purposes, but may not include sufficient information to reproduce the Pcb.

example.p: Some of the information in figures 2 and 3 may be included in a usage view; especially that information that communicate fit tolerances.

for the Layered_interconnect_module_usage_view. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
